text: So we just wrapped up episode two of Outlier Trading Boot Camp and here is this week's trading prompt. We talked a lot about risk management. The episode will be available next Tuesday. But in the meantime, I want to hear your guys' thoughts. What is one piece of risk management advice that you would give to a close friend or relative that was interested in getting involved with investing? What would you tell them? For me, it is to focus on good, risk-to-reward ratios and not allowing losses to compound and remove your account. You can't make money if you don't exist. What would you share with your friends? Throw it in the comments below. Let's talk about it.

metadata.title: What Would You Tell a Close Friend? #shorts
metadata.description:

#Trading #Stocks #riskmanagement 

My name is Erik. I'm a Marine Veteran, information activist, and trader for 15+ years. 
I don't come from money and am nothing special - yet I still made my first million before I was 30. The stock market played a critical role in my ability to develop wealth. 

What is esInvests? 
A community dedicated to becoming financial Outliers without the BS. Here, I share my first hand experience developing wealth via trading, real estate, and angel investing. 

What can you expect?
Outlier Community, Investing basics, options trading, portfolio management, trading psychology, trading strategy, money management, live trading, live market reviews, trader workshops, real estate / angel investing + some fun along the way. 

Welcome to the Outliers!

I am not a financial advisor. All content is shared for educational and entertainment purposes only.
